result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Pulaski

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:42 AM Attorney Daniel W Johns Jr in court for Mark E Pulaski.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def FTA.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Johns indicates that def thought court was on October 7th.  Atty Johns asks for adj.  Court to just address STC.  Atty Johns has reviewed offer with client and hopes to have resolution.  PTC to be set for 10/18.  Parties to contact court to schedule.  Def excused today based on misunderstanding.  Adj. 11:45 a.m.  klr
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:01 AM 22CM12 and 22CF23.  Defendant Mark E Pulaski in court.  Attorney Daniel W Johns Jr in court for Mark E Pulaski.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. DA provides background.  Atty Johns indicates STC to be set for 10/3 at 11:30 a.m. both cases.  Atty Johns asks court for direction re him getting belongings from home after divorce.  Def believes ex-wife won't be present.  Atty Johns indicates he has 30 days to retrieve items.  Court modifies bond to allow def to contact vic in writing to set up date and time for him to retrieve property (or via text).  Will address after October 3.  Per Court, bond not modified.  Parties to facilitate through Vic/Witness coordinator.  Adj.  11:06 a.m.  klr
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:40 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Dan Johns appears in person with def.  Atty Johns provides background and parties request PTC.  DA wants to check with victim.  DA anticipates offer going out this week.  Parties to set 8/9 at 11:00 a.m. PTC.  Adj.  10:42 adj.  klr
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:09 AM Defendant Mark E Pulaski in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Warrant was issued.  Def posted with condition to return today.  $1150 total posted at this time.  Def has received complaint.  Def may get atty but will appear today without atty.  Rights have been gone through prior.  Def pleads NG.  DA requests no contact with vic.  Court questions def-doesn't need contact.  Does not object to $500 being returned and $650 being set.  Def posted himself.  $650 cash/no contact with vic.  March 23 at 10:30 a.m. PTC.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark E Pulaski
Current: 24 Indiana Avenue, Montreal, WI 54550 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2022)
Prior: 3839 Popko Circle E, Mercer, WI 54547
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Mark E Pulaski not in court. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Case set for 9:00 a.m.  Court questions if def personally served.  Summons was mailed, no returned mail.  DA requests warrant authorized.  Court authorizes Iron and Adj. counties.  Can post $500/appear following Monday.  DA can issue warrant at own discretion.  Adj.  9:33 a.m.  klr
